indiscriminate.中释: 任意的；无差别的；不分皂白的
indiscriminate.英释: an indiscriminate action is done without thinking about what harm it might cause

superintendent.中释: 监督人；负责人；主管；指挥者
superintendent.英释: someone who is in charge of all the schools in a particular area in the US

unconscionable.中释: 不合理的；昧着良心的；肆无忌惮的；过度的
unconscionable.英释: much more than is reasonable or acceptable

verisimilitude.中释: 逼真，貌似真实；逼真的事物
verisimilitude.英释: the quality of being true or real

indecipherable.中释: 无法解释的；破译不出的；难辨认的

reconciliation.英释: a situation in which two people, countries etc become friendly with each other again after quarrelling

neutralization.中释: [化学] 中和；[化学] 中和作用；中立状态

extemporaneous.中释: 即席的，临时的；无准备的；不用讲稿的；善于即席讲话的
extemporaneous.英释: spoken or done without any preparation or practice

circumnavigate.英释: to sail, fly, or travel completely around the Earth, an island etc

characteristic.英释: a quality or feature of something or someone that is typical of them and easy to recognize

photosynthesis.英释: the production by a green plant of special substances like sugar that it uses as food, caused by the action of sunlight on  chlorophyll (= the green substance in leaves )

multiplication.英释: a method of calculating in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

circumlocution.中释: 婉转曲折的说法，累赘的陈述；遁辞
circumlocution.英释: the practice of using too many words to express an idea, instead of saying it directly
